intro: Pentacalia divisoria, commonly known as the divided pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or limestone soils. Its leaves are divided into narrow segments, giving it a distinctive appearance. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more often found in its natural habitat.
